subcategory: Insufficient Number of Female Applicants for Returnship Programs

content.text: This refers to the situation when there aren't enough females applying for the programs that assist people in returning to the job after taking a career break.
Self-limiting beliefs of females hold them back from achieving their full potential.
Due to cultural barriers and family responsibilities, females don’t apply for returnship programs.
There is a general perception in the minds of people that females are not responsible for earning for their households.
Organizations are not promoting returnship programs using the appropriate channels.
Launch awareness programs to inform women about the benefits of returnship programs.
Organizations should promote returnship programs using targeted channels to ensure that they reach women who have taken career breaks.
Organizations must design returnship programs that offer flexible working hours and remote work options so that women can balance their home and work responsibilities.
Recruiters and hiring managers should be trained to recognize and eliminate biases to ascertain fair evaluation of candidates.
